text: Cory Cogeneration Station is a natural gas-fired station owned by SaskPower and located near Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, Canada. The plant operates at 260 MW in a conventional generation mode and at 228 MW in a cogeneration mode. Steam from the plant is used to supply the Potash Corp Cory Mine. == Description == The Cory Cogeneration Station consists of:Plant Description * two GE PG 7121EA Gas Turbines (85 MW) * two Heat Recovery Steam Generators (140 tonnes per hour) and * one GE Steam Turbine (90 MW) == See also == * SaskPower ==References== == External links == * SaskPower Station Description Category:Natural gas-fired power stations in Saskatchewan Category:Buildings and structures in Saskatoon Category:ATCO Category:Vanscoy No. 345, Saskatchewan
title: Cory Cogeneration Station
